sen.j: 大炊御門 経久（おおいのみかど つねひさ、天明元年9月16日 (旧暦)（1781年11月1日） - 安政6年7月10日 (旧暦)（1859年8月8日））は、江戸時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Tsunehisa OINOMIKADO (November 1, 1781 - August 8, 1859) was Kugyo (court noble) in the late Edo period.
Tsunehisa OINOMIKADO (November 1, 1781 - August 8, 1859) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: court noble→a Court Nobleに訂正しました。
sen.e: Tsunehisa OINOMIKADO (November 1, 1781 - August 8, 1859) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 光格天皇（119代）・仁孝天皇（120代）・孝明天皇（121代）の三朝にわたり仕え、官位は従一位右大臣まで進む。
sen.e: He served the Imperial Court for three reigns, Emperor Kokaku (119th), Emperor Ninko (120th) and Emperor Komei (121st) and was promoted to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank, minister of the right).

He served for the three sovereigns who were the 119th Emperor Kokaku, the 120th Emperor Ninko and the 121st Emperor Komei; He was promoted up to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: Imperial Courtを削除しました。Reigns→sovereignsに訂正し、who wereを追加しました。訳抜けのため、promoted up to としました。Junior First Rankのあとにandを追加し、ministerの頭大文字にしました。
sen.e: He served for the three sovereigns who were the 119th Emperor Kokaku, the 120th Emperor Ninko and the 121st Emperor Komei; He was promoted up to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Right).

sen.j: 父は右大臣大炊御門家孝。
sen.e: His father was Udaijin Ietaka OINOMIKADO.
His father was Udaijin Ietaka OINOMIKADO.
His father was Udaijin Ietaka OINOMIKADO.

sen.j: 母は右大臣三条季晴の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Udaijin Sueharu SANJO.
His mother was a daughter of Udaijin Sueharu SANJO.
His mother was a daughter of Udaijin Sueharu SANJO.

sen.j: 室は権大納言中山忠尹の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Tadamasa NAKAYAMA.
His wife was a daughter of Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) Tadamasa NAKAYAMA.
sen.cmt: provisional major counselorの各頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) Tadamasa NAKAYAMA.

sen.j: 子に侍従大炊御門経長、右近衛中将大炊御門経尚、右大臣大炊御門家信、今城経明（今城家養子）がいる。
sen.e: He had children, Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) Tsunenaga OINOMIKADO, Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) Tunenao OINOMIKADO, and Udaijin Ienobu OINOMIKADO, and 今城経明 (an adopted child of the Imaki family).

He had several children including Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) Tsunenaga OINOMIKADO, "Ukone no chujo" (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) Tunenao OINOMIKADO, and Udaijin Ienobu OINOMIKADO, and 今城経明 (the child adopted by the Imaki family).
sen.cmt: several, includingを追加し、Ukone no Chujoに""を追加しました。an adopted child of the Imaki family→the child adopted by the Imaki familyに訂正しました。
sen.e: He had several children including Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) Tsunenaga OINOMIKADO, "Ukone no chujo" (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) Tunenao OINOMIKADO, and Udaijin Ienobu OINOMIKADO, and 今城経明 (the child adopted by the Imaki family).

sen.j: 天明2年（1782年）に叙爵してから清華家当主として早いスピードで昇進し、侍従・右近衛権少将・右近衛権中将などを歴任し、寛政元年（1789年）に従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1782, he was quickly promoted as the family head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for court nobles) and successively held various posts such as Jiju, Ukone no Gon no shosho, Ukone no Gon no chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and then, he took the post of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1789 and was ranked with Kugyo.

After he was conferred a peerage in 1782, being the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; He held different positions such as Jiju, "Ukone no Gon no shosho"(Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), "Ukone no Gon no chujo" (Provisional Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards); He took the position of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1789, which gave him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 誤訳です。he was quickly promoted as the family head of the Seiga familyの部分を訂正しました。各文を;でつなぎました。Various→differentに訂正しました。複数単語で連なった役職に""を追加しました。Post→positionに訂正しました。定訳より、Ukone no Gon no shoshoの訳を追加しました。Was ranked withをwhich gave him the titleに訂正しました。
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1782, being the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; He held different positions such as Jiju, "Ukone no Gon no shosho"(Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), "Ukone no Gon no chujo" (Provisional Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards); He took the position of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1789, which gave him the title Kugyo.

sen.j: その後も権中納言、権大納言、踏歌節会外弁・内弁を経て、文政4年（1821年）には右近衛大将・右馬寮御監となる。
sen.e: After that, he served as Gon Chunagon, Gon Dainagon, Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony)) and naiben, he became Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Umaryo gogen (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) in 1821.

Since then, he successively held different positions such as "Gon Chunagon"(Provisional Vice-Councilor of State), "Gon Dainagon"(Provisional Major Counselor), "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]) and "Toka no sechie Naiben" (Kugyo who supervised the event of toka [ceremonial mass singing and stomp dancing] which was called "Toka no sechie" held at the Imperial Court on around the fifteenth day of the first month of the year, inside the Shomeimon Gate of the Kyoto Imperial Palace); He became "Ukone no daisho" (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Umaryo gogen" (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) in 1821.
sen.cmt: After that→since thenに訂正しました。He servces as→He successively held different positions such asに訂正しました。定訳より、Gon Chunagon, Gon Dainagon, Toka no sechie Naiben の訳を追加しました。各文を;でつなぎました。各役職に""を追加し、()内のカッコを[]に訂正しました。
sen.e: Since then, he successively held different positions such as "Gon Chunagon"(Provisional Vice-Councilor of State), "Gon Dainagon"(Provisional Major Counselor), "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]) and "Toka no sechie Naiben" (Kugyo who supervised the event of toka [ceremonial mass singing and stomp dancing] which was called "Toka no sechie" held at the Imperial Court on around the fifteenth day of the first month of the year, inside the Shomeimon Gate of the Kyoto Imperial Palace); He became "Ukone no daisho" (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Umaryo gogen" (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) in 1821.

sen.j: 文政7年（1824年）に従一位内大臣となるも同年辞職。
sen.e: Although he became Juichii Naidaijin (Junior First Rank, minister of the center) in 1824, he resigned the post in the same year.
Although he became Juichii Naidaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Center) in 1824, he resigned the position within the same year.
sen.cmt: andを追加しました。役職の頭文字を大文字にしました。post→positionに訂正しました。In→withinに訂正しました。
sen.e: Although he became Juichii Naidaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Center) in 1824, he resigned the position within the same year.

sen.j: その後長く政界を離れていたが、安政4年（1857年）に右大臣に就任している。
sen.e: After that, he left the world of politics for a long time, but, he took the post of Udaijin in 1857.
Since then, he was away from politics for a long time; However, he returned to take the position of Udaijin in 1857.
sen.cmt: After that→Since then, left the world of politics→was away from politics, but→; however, took the post→returned to take the position に訂正しました。
sen.e: Since then, he was away from politics for a long time; However, he returned to take the position of Udaijin in 1857.
